entry.title: The Learning and Skills Act (Commencement No. 2 and Savings) Order 2000

ukm:Subject.Value: EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order brings provisions of the Learning and Skills Act 2000 specified in Part I of the Schedule into force on 1st October 2000, the provisions of that Act specified in Part II of the Schedule into force on 1st November 2000, and the provisions of that Act specified in Part III of the Schedule into force on 1st January 2001. In one case the commencement is subject to savings.

entry.title: The Medicines (Products Other Than Veterinary Drugs) (General Sale List) Amendment (No. 2) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order further amends the Medicines (Products Other Than Veterinary Drugs) (General Sale List) Order 1984 (“the principal Order”) which specifies classes of medicinal products which can with reasonable safety be sold or supplied otherwise than by or under the supervision of a pharmacist (the general sale list).

title.div: The Local Authorities (Members' Allowances) (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2000 / Rheoliadau Awdurdodau Lleol (Lwfansau Aelodau) (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2000

div.p: Section 173 of the Local Government Act 1972 makes provision for a member of, in England, a parish or, in Wales, a community council who is a councillor to receive a payment by way of attendance allowance which does not exceed the amount prescribed by regulations and for a member of such a council who is not entitled to receive such a payment to receive a payment by way of financial loss allowance which does not exceed the amount prescribed by regulations.

Mae adran 173 o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 1972 yn gwneud darpariaeth i aelod o gyngor plwyf yn Lloegr neu o gyngor cymuned yng Nghymru sy'n gynghorydd gael taliad yn lwfans presenoldeb nad yw'n fwy na'r swm a ragnodir drwy gyfrwng rheoliadau ac i aelod o gyngor o'r fath nad oes ganddo hawl i gael taliad o'r fath gael taliad yn lwfans colled ariannol nad yw'n fwy na'r swm a ragnodir drwy gyfrwng rheoliadau.

entry.title: The Immigration (Variation of Leave) (Amendment) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order amends the Immigration (Variation of Leave) Order 1976 to exclude from its provisions those who have made an application for variation of limited leave to enter or remain where the decision on the application is not made before 2nd October 2000. Instead, section 3C of the Immigration Act 1971 (continuation of leave pending decision), as inserted by section 3 of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999, will apply to such persons.

entry.title: The Energy Act 1976 (Reserve Powers) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order declares that the powers of control by order and government directions contained respectively in sections 1 and 2 of the Energy Act 1976 are exercisable to their fullest extent because there is imminent in the United Kingdom a threatened emergency affecting fuel supplies.

entry.title: The Time Off for Public Duties (No. 2) Order 2000
entry.summary: Section 50 of the Employment Rights Act 1996 requires an employer to allow time off during working hours, subject to the provisions of the section, to an employee of his who is a justice of the peace or who is a member of a body set out in section 50(2). A “relevant education body” is one of the bodies mentioned in section 50(2), and section 50(9) lists the relevant education bodies.

entry.title: The Immigration Appeals (Family Visitor) (No. 2) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the Immigration Appeals (Family Visitor) Regulations 2000. They define who is to be regarded as a family visitor for the purposes of section 60 of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999 (the Act), which gives a person who seeks to enter the United Kingdom as a visitor the right of appeal against a refusal of entry clearance if he is a family visitor.

entry.title: The Ashworth, Broadmoor and Rampton Hospital Authorities (Functions and Membership) Amendment Regulations 2000

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Ashworth, Broadmoor and Rampton Hospital Authorities (Functions and Membership) Regulations 1996 to provide that during the period between the establishment date of an NHS trust and its operational date, the chairman or a non-executive director of the trust may hold office as the chairman or a non-officer member of the Ashworth Hospital Authority, the Broadmoor Hospital Authority or the Rampton Hospital Authority.

entry.title: The National Health Service Litigation Authority (Amendment) Regulations 2000

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Health Service Litigation Authority Regulations 1995 to provide that a non-executive director of an NHS trust may hold office as the chairman or a non-officer member of the National Health Service Litigation Authority.

entry.title: The National Health Service Trusts (Membership and Procedure) Amendment (England) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations amend, in respect of England, the National Health Service Trusts (Membership and Procedure) Regulations 1990 (“the 1990 Regulations”) which make provision in connection with the membership and procedure of NHS trusts established under Part I of the National Health Service and Community Care Act 1990.

entry.title: The Protection of Children (Child Care Organisations) Regulations 2000

ukm:Subject.Value: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: CHILDREN AND YOUNG PERSONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe enactments for the purposes of section 12(1) of the Protection of Children Act 1999, which requires the Secretary of State to keep a list of persons considered unsuitable to work with children. The Act requires child care organisations to refer individuals to him for inclusion on that list, in certain circumstances, and prohibits them from offering employment in a child care position to any individual who is included in the list. An organisation is a “child care organisation” subject to those provisions only if its activities are regulated by or by virtue of an enactment prescribed by the Secretary of State. Regulation 2 prescribes enactments for those purposes.

entry.title: The County of Hertfordshire (Electoral Changes) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, without modification, to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the county of Hertfordshire. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on and after 3rd May 2001.

entry.title: The National Health Service (General Dental Services) Amendment Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the National Health Service (General Dental Services) Regulations 1992 (S.I. 1992/661) (“the 1992 Regulations”) which regulate the terms on which general dental services are provided under the National Health Service Act 1977. The Regulations, other than regulation 4 which extends to England and Wales, extend to England only.

entry.title: The County of Somerset (Electoral Changes) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, with one modification, to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the county of Somerset. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on or after 3rd May 2001.

entry.title: The Electricity Works (Environmental Impact Assessment) (Scotland) Regulations 2000
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Council Directive 85/337/EEC (O.J. No. L 175, 5.7.85, p.40) as amended by Council Directive 97/11/EC (O.J. No. L 73, 14.3.97, p.5) on the assessment of certain public and private projects on the environment insofar as it relates to applications for consent to construct, extend or operate a power station or install or keep installed overhead electricity lines under sections 36 and 37 of the Electricity Act 1989.

entry.title: The County of Cumbria (Electoral Changes) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, without modification, to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the county of Cumbria. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on or after 3rd May 2001.

entry.title: The County of Lincolnshire (Electoral Changes) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, subject to the modifications detailed below, to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the county of Lincolnshire. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on and after 3rd May 2001.

entry.title: The County of Cheshire (Electoral Changes) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, without modification, to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the county of Cheshire. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on and after 3rd May 2001.

entry.title: The Immigration and Asylum Act 1999 (Commencement No. 6, Transitional and Consequential Provisions) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order brings into force the following provisions of the Immigration and Asylum Act 1999 (the 1999 Act), so far as not already in force. Apart from sections 32 and 34 to 37 which come into force for certain additional purposes on 18th September 2000, the provisions come into force on 2nd October 2000:

entry.title: The County of Northumberland (Electoral Changes) Order 2000
entry.summary: This Order gives effect, with modifications, to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the county of Northumberland. The changes have effect in relation to local government elections to be held on and after 3rd May 2001.
